text: Stefan Eck is a German politician, who, since 2014, has been a Member of the European Parliament, representing Germany. He was elected representing Human Environment Animal Protection, but left the party in December 2014. He sits as an Independent in the European United Left–Nordic Green Left group. Since January 2020 he enterd the Ecological Democratic Party. ==Work at the European Parliament== In the European Parliament, he is vice president of the Intergroup on Animal Welfare and Conservationhttp://www.animalwelfareintergroup.eu/wp- content/uploads/2011/08/TAGESORDNUNG-304.pdf and a full member of the Committee on the Environment, Public Health and Food Safety. He is also a substitute member of the Committee on Agriculture and Rural Development and the Committee on Women's Rights and Gender Equality and Delegations for relations with the People's Republic of China, the countries of South Asia, the countries of Southeast Asia and the Association of Southeast Asian States and for relations with the Korean Peninsula.http://www.europarl.europa.eu/meps/de/124863/STEFAN_ECK_home.html He is also a founding member of the Interparliamentary Interest Group "MEPs for Wildlife". His main activities include animal and human rights as well as environmental protection. == References == Category:Living people Category:1956 births Category:MEPs for Germany 2014–2019 Category:Ecological Democratic Party politicians Category:Human Environment Animal Protection MEPs Category:Politicians from Hamburg
title: Stefan Eck
